alert.note: Alert for Park (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 9:11PM MDT until June 14 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River near Livingston affecting Sweet Grass and Park Counties. Yellowstone River at Corwin Springs affecting Park County. .Periods of heavy rain falling on a deep primed snowpack will cause continued melting and increasing river flows. Expect falling water levels by Tuesday as cooler and drier air arrives. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellowstone River at Corwin Springs. * WHEN...From Monday morning to Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, the river reaches bankfull with minor flooding of lowland areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM MDT Sunday the stage was 8.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to peak near or slightly below flood stage early Monday morning. Expect falling water levels tomorrow afternoon through Thursday. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.9 feet on 06/10/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Yellowstone River Corwin Spring 11.0 8.8 Sun 7 pm 10.0 8.7 7.5 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. Safety message...A river Flood Warning means river flooding is expected to impact people and property in the warned area. Prepare for flooding impacts associated with the forecast river levels in your location. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Monday afternoon at 1230 PM MDT.
